Method Detail

createContents

private void createContents(java.lang.String fileName,
                            java.lang.String text)
This method creates a file for .xml content type. This file stores information such as Users, League, Matches, and so on.

Parameters:
fileName - The file name. For instance, teste-users.xml
text - The data which will be stored in the .xml file

getContents

private <T> java.util.ArrayList<T> getContents(java.lang.String fileName)
This is a generic method. It is responsible to return the contents of .xml file. This content can be Users, Leagues, Matches and so on.

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
fileName - The file name which contains the desired contents
Returns:
It returns a generic array which stores the information above cited

setDatabase

public void setDatabase(java.lang.String databaseName)
This method initialize the file path which will contain all information about Users, Leagues, Matches, etc

Specified by:
setDatabase in interface PersistenceIF
Parameters:
databaseName - All files will have a common name followed by its property. For instance: teste-users.xml, teste-leagues.xml, etc. This param will hold this common name

findMatchesByDate

public java.util.ArrayList<Match> findMatchesByDate(League league,
                                                    java.util.Date initDate,
                                                    java.util.Date finalDate)
Finds matches for a given league, initial and final dates

Specified by:
findMatchesByDate in interface PersistenceIF
Parameters:
league - The league object
initDate - The initial date
finalDate - The final date
Returns:
Returns a list of Matches object which is associated with the given league and the actual date is between initDate date and finalDate date

findMatchesByDate

public java.util.ArrayList<Match> findMatchesByDate(User user,
                                                    League league,
                                                    java.util.Date initDate,
                                                    java.util.Date finalDate)
Finds matches for a given league, initial and final dates and the given user (player) is

Specified by:
findMatchesByDate in interface PersistenceIF
Parameters:
user - The User object which is in the desired match
league - The League object which is in the desired match
initDate - The initial date
finalDate - The final date
Returns:
Returns a list of Matches object which is associated with the given league, contains the given user and the actual date is between initDate date and finalDate date
